content.title: Suggested articles
content.visibleText:
LEGACY ONBOARDING
Idle cards idle cards appear when you don't have enough activity on a single timecard to bill the customer for it.
AUTOMATIC REIMPORTING DATA FROM LEARNING APPS
Problem Background Sometimes we find bugs in the import implementation and after we fix them, there's a need to reimport data from a particular learning app for weekly.
WS LAMBDA TEAM ONLINE
Automatically move ticket to In Progress when IC is active for more than 30 mins (logged 3 timecards in XO). LAMBDA-20473

content.title: Description
content.layoutDescription: Text input field with formatting options
content.visibleText:
Insight: Gemini 1.5pro proved great at processing video
Objective: extract content from video and test out current models
Things to explore:
- take a WSIP video of 10 or 30 minutes and ask it to
- extract raw content: similar to our current prompt, but see if Gemini accounts for the motion to do its own consolidation and split-out stuff
- extract consolidated content: extract all documents it has seen, all chat conversations, all emails, all code

AUTOMATIC REIMPORTING DATA FROM LEARNING APPS
Problem Background Sometimes we find bugs in the import implementation and after we fix them, there's a need to reimport data from a particular learning app for weekly
WS LAMBDA TEAM ONLINE
Automatically move ticket to In Progress when IC is active for more than 30 mins (logged 3 timecards in XO), LAMBDA-20473

content.title: Description
content.visibleText:
Objective: extract content from video using test out current vision enabled models (Gemini 1.5pro, GPT40, Claude3 opus)
- this way, we won't have to process each frame and hopefully neither assemble content from multiples screenshots and instead rely on the LLM to extract the (document) content
- the ideal output would be to have all content from all apps they have been using, this may not be possible, so the question is how much can we get and how small do we need we need videos to be
- we don't care much about verbatim content, if the result we get is what we would get from say "chain of density"-like approach
- start with 30 minute videos as people tend to work on multiple things at the same time and content can easily spread out across a timeline. if results are bad, go 10 minutes. Output limits can impact this decision.
